intro: Faramea oraria, commonly known as the silverleaf faramea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Madagascar. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and economically important species. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves that often have a silvery or pale underside, giving it its common name. It produces small, white or pinkish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Faramea oraria is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its attractive foliage and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
